Topic.Title: Obama standards will double car prices

Message.Msg: For all of you're complaining about gas prices, I would think you'd appreciate the CAFE standards. Not only will you use less gas, your Priuses will get cheaper as technology is developed, and the lowered demand for gas will put downward pressure on fuel prices. It's a win for everyone but the oil companies. They'll spend alot of money to convince you otherwise, but don't believe them.

Message.Title: Clint's speech...
Message.Msg: ... I haven’t seen a speech like Clint Eastwood’s since Rick Perry’s in New Hampshire in October, when he rambled on and on with his slurred speech so much that folks thought he was on Quaaludes. I think serious disservice was done to the GOP cause, by permitting Eastwood to ramble on to an empty chair, making throat cutting gestures, suggesting “they” own America, implying that the empty chair (POTUS) was telling him to go fock himself, and ending with a famous line from his macho movies (“Make my day”) suggesting he was about to blow somebody away at the slightest provocation, particularly in this day and age. In fairness, it would appear he had carte blanche permission to freelance, and word has it that many in the RNC were grimacing and squirming in their seats, while listening to Eastwood’s least impressive role since his brief appearance as a sailor in “Francis (the talking mule) in the Navy” early in his career. Unfortunately, it would appear many (not all) of those in attendance, (mostly angry, old, white guys, the Tea Party stalwarts not unlike Eastwood’s character Walt Kowalski in “Gran Torino”) ate it up. Did the rest of America? Stay tuned. I, for one, a fan of much of his later work, was extremely disappointed in this performance, and do not feel it was at all appropriate. JMO.
I agree that it didn't do much for either the GOP or Clint. Ron Paul could have made better use of the time.

Topic.Title: Obama standards will double car prices

Message.Msg: Lawyer designed cars are certain to cost at least double. Even the best hybrids don't get that kind of mileage. A well designed motorcycle with a side car might do it but even that would have to be a hybrid with regenerative braking system.

It was awesome - completely awesome. It was the only thing about the entire Convention that was not sophomoric and depressing. Right from Anne "Stepford" Romney on down. The only thing Clint could have done to make his performance more relevant would to have waved a gun at a woman's uterus while screaming, "I own that", and then shoot a couple of gay guys or lesbians right in the forehead with the gun while intoning, "Get back in your place you F'n ni**ers!" That would have wrapped up the GOP in a nutshell - special emphasis on the word "nut". Interesting article in the NYT contrasting the platform in '80 with today. Reagan looks like a screaming left wing pinko compared to the anti-intellectual pandering tools that were trotted out on stage this week. "When sleeping women wake, mountains move".

Cars are part of our "American Heritage" we want to be independent, a horse would be cheaper, and more friendly to our environment. This is true even with the road apples. I thought it was hilarious. Local-comedy bar where they sell jello-shots kind of hilarious, but hilarious nonetheless. This is just poor. The three main stories coming out of the convention? Paul Ryan is a pathological liar, Clint Eastwood made a d**che of himself, Anne Romney experienced some of the normal challenges of life and had plenty of bank to deal with them. 3 days. How do you think 4 years will look?

>>>Obama-" If you've got a business, you didn't build that. Somebody else made that happen," he said. If you leave out the "that" he had been speaking about for several minutes: schools, roads, government research the internet. This is the flip side of attacking Romney for saying he likes to fire people. You can be a "gotcha" person, or you can be a respectable human being. The choice is yours. The full quote: If you were successful, somebody along the line gave you some help. There was a great teacher somewhere in your life. Somebody helped to create this unbelievable American system that we have that allowed you to thrive. Somebody invested in roads and bridges. If you’ve got a business. you didn’t build that. Somebody else made that happen. The Internet didn’t get invented on its own. Government research created the Internet so that all the companies could make money off the Internet. The point is, is that when we succeed, we succeed because of our individual initiative, but also because we do things together. There are some things, just like fighting fires, we don’t do on our own. I mean, imagine if everybody had their own fire service. That would be a hard way to organize fighting fires. So we say to ourselves, ever since the founding of this country, you know what, there are some things we do better together. That’s how we funded the GI Bill. That’s how we created the middle class. That’s how we built the Golden Gate Bridge or the Hoover Dam. That’s how we invented the Internet. That’s how we sent a man to the moon. We rise or fall together as one nation and as one people, and that’s the reason I’m running for president – because I still believe in that idea. You’re not on your own, we’re in this together.”

>>>if you’re the kid in the back of the class imitating a walrus with pencils in his nostrils while making armpit noises, while giggling like a third grade girl. That's the kind of funny Clint Eastwood was! Clint should've shot spitwads at the chair. Spitwads were awesome.

>>>MS and Cancer are a normal thing Illness and poor health are parts of most people's lives, unfortunately. So is raising kids. These are the challenges Anne Romney faced. Anne Romney did overcome them, and I am sure she is one tough lady. They are much easier overcome if you have money, insurance, and you don't have to work a job or two while overcoming them. Unfortunately, alot of people don't overcome them because of this. They succumb to illness or become disabled, their children become latch key children because they can't get daycare, or the bills mount up and the lose their savings and house or can't afford to eat or feed their kids. These are things Anne Romney never had to think about, much less experience. It's just a different world the Romney's and Ryans lived in. They may have faced challenges, but they never struggled just to survive or make ends meet. I'm sure they're fine, "tough" people. They just don't understand the world 99% of Americans experience on a daily basis. And their politics show it.

Message.Title: After Hours Quotes...
Message.Msg: ... “The discipline of the written word punishes both stupidity and dishonesty.” – John Steinbeck “Facts are the bounds of human knowledge set for it, not by it.” – William James http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7giOrKYIwpQ “The Republican National Convention is in full swing in Tampa. Speeches are being made. Hats flown in the air. Everyone gets their own hippie to slap around.”- Craig Ferguson “I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our moneyed corporations, which dare already to challenge our government to a trial of strength and bid defiance to the laws of our country.” – Thomas Jefferson “I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.” – Jorge Luis Borges "Some of the Republicans, I think, are over-reacting to Hurricane Isaac — like today Rick Santorum was seen gathering up two of every animal…This is a big storm. In fact, Isaac has scared more senior citizens than Paul Ryan.” – Jay Leno http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/23/2012/08/26/117537_600.jpg “Like music my drawings transport us to the ambiguous world of the indeterminate.” – Odilon Redon “Physics is not religion. If it were, we'd have a much easier time raising money.” – Leon Lederman “No one rises so high as he who knows not whither he is going.” – Oliver Cromwell "According to The New York Times, Iraq now loves American fast food. They hate us but they love our fast food. This is how we work. We force democracy on them and then we sneak in morbid obesity." –David Letterman “I got the bill for my surgery. Now I know what those doctors were wearing masks for.” James H. Boren "NASA has actually landed a car on Mars. It's called the Curiosity. That vehicle, now on Mars, cost two and a half million dollars. But when you drive that thing off the lot, instantly it's worth less than half that…They test drove the Curiosity over the weekend and it was digging a hole. It got bigger and bigger, digging a huge deep hole. It's like Todd Akin.” – David Letterman “If a man walked in the woods for love of them half of each day, he is in danger of being regarded as a loafer, but if he spends his whole day as a speculator shearing of those woods and making earth bald before her time, he is estimated as an industrious and enterprising citizen—as if a town had no interest in forests but to cut them down. “ – Thoreau “There was a time in my life when I thought I had everything - millions of dollars, mansions, cars, nice clothes, beautiful women, and every other materialistic thing you can imagine. Now I struggle for peace.” – Richard Pryor

It is every living object's sole reason for living.” – Richard Dawkins “Drunk, if you like; so much the worse for those who fear wine, for it is because they have bad thoughts which they are afraid the liquor will extract from their hearts.” – Alexandre Dumas "Because of the approaching hurricane, everyone is making contingency plans. Paul Ryan went to Florida early, Mitt battened down his hair, and Newt Gingrich says he likes hurricanes and said he looks forward to getting blown behind a dumpster." –Bill Maher http://media.caglecartoons.com/media/cartoons/53/2012/08/30/117869_600.jpg “The nature of our free will is the comprehension of our unique place within the universal order.” – Alex Mero “Who then understands the reciprocal flux and reflux of the infinitely great and the infinitely small, the echoing of causes in the abysses of being, and the avalanches of creation?” – Victor Hugo "Yesterday a medical marijuana group officially endorsed President Obama for president. Doesn't really help Obama though, because they were just getting around to endorsing him for 2008." - Conan O'Brien “The power of Thought; the magic of the Mind!” – Lord Byron “Have a good weekend, all.” – echo2165 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R0T5jRn9rV8 “There are intangible realities which float near us, formless and without words; realities which no one has thought out, and which are excluded for lack of interpreters." - Natalie Clifford

Mayor Ray Nagin fled New Orleans and sat in a fancy Dallas hotel bar while he watched the levy breach caused by Katrina devastate New Orleans, he did nothing to get the people of what he likes to call his "chocolate city" prepared to evacuate. He let hundreds of buses that could have been used evacuate people sit idle. In July of 2005, New Orleans Mayor Nagin prepared DVDs warning that, if the city ever had to be evacuated, residents were on their own. A couple days before Katrina hit New Orleans, Governor Jeb Bush of Florida called Louisiana Governor Kathleen Blanco. The first time he called her, her aids said she was taking a nap and couldn't be disturbed, but they would ask her to call back. After not receiving a call back Jeb called back again and got ahold of her. He told her that he help her evacuate the New Orleans hospitals. She told him that she would think about it and get back to him. She never called back. President Bush began to communicate the extreme emergency to the Governor and the Mayor days before the storm hit. President Bush asked the City Mayor to declare a mandatory evacuation but the Mayor refused. President Bush urged the Governor to sign the papers needed so that he could order the Federal personnel into position to help. He even made out the paperwork for the Governor, but the Governor refused to sign it, making it illegal for President Bush to help those poor people in New Orleans. The Governor apparently saw it as a kind of political power struggle.

Topic.Title: Clint should have heeded his own advice::

Message.Msg: I think he represented the Republicans perfectly. An angry old white man arguing with an imaginary Obama.

Meanwhile DEMOCRAT senator William J. Jefferson was rescuing $90K of cash he had collected from bribes hidden in his freezer. He tied up military personnel and equiptment for hours that while he rescued his cash, this is equipment that could have been used to help the Katrina victims during a time is was urgently needed. Jefferson, was convicted on Aug. 5, 2009 of using his office to try to enrich himself and relatives through a web of bribes and payoffs. And people wonder why democrats are perceived as liars and thieves

Topic.Title: Clint should have heeded his own advice::

Message.Msg: It was great. Too bad they didn't just bring out an empty suit. All the lib news reports noted he was 82 years old. It doesn't matter if he was 102. The older the better. Great humor, had to be thinking about what Barry would be saying. Didn't drop any F bombs like a rapper dude, or a Rosie O'donnell would have. I'm sure Barry was taking gas. Clint, really nailed Biden also. He does act like Grinning Cheshire Cat. Will they say Clint is a bigot? Can't anyone disagree with This poor excuse for a President?

Then don't vote for him. He's in jail for 13 years where he should be. What the he** does this have to do with anything we're discussing? I know you people have completely run out of anything useful to say when you go into "a democrat did this once, a democrat did that once" mode.

I was really surprised how really relaxed, and down to earth Jeb was. But with a name like that (after a civil war General), Jeb has got to give up ever being a President. It's a good thing he doesn't hold a grudge against George. The real problem is we have had some terrible Presidents in the modern era, Carter, Bush, and Obummer. Losers, one and all. I really believe Mitt can help. With his business background, and Paul's economic degree/knowledge. Anyone has gotta do better than Barry. If bu!!crap was music, as my Dad would say, Obama would be leading the band. Barry really feels he hasn't communicated his position very well. I know so many people that whenever Barry talks, they change the tv, or just cut it off. No one wants to hear you whine. It's way past the time when we should have seen some action. But, as Rubio has said, Barry has become a much better golfer on our dime. And Mouchelle vacations well.
